title: tidymodels-ames-01

---









# Aufgabe

Berechnen Sie ein lineares Modell mit tidymodels und zwar anhand des `ames` Datensatzes.

Modellgleichung: `Sale_Price ~ Gr_Liv_Area, data = ames`.

Berechnen Sie ein multiplikatives (exponenzielles) Modell.

Gesucht ist R-Quadrat als Maß für die Modellgüte im *Train-Sample*.



*Hinweise*:

- Fixieren Sie die Zufallszahlen auf den Startwert 42.




</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>

# Lösung



::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-01_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_31b76eb19b3f595bd6a8cab7da28b8ab'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidymodels)
data(ames)
```
:::



Multiplikatives Modell:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-01_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_e5791d65aeaf399b0951ed6636fbc778'}

```{.r .cell-code}
ames <- 
  ames %>% 
  mutate(Sale_Price = log10(Sale_Price))
```
:::



Datensatz aufteilen:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-01_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_62767cc6434c66ce0e012536c65fb9b4'}

```{.r .cell-code}
ames_split <- initial_split(ames, prop = 0.80, strata = Sale_Price)
ames_train <- training(ames_split)
ames_test  <-  testing(ames_split)
```
:::




Modell definieren:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-01_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_16c4a9ea41ad39705066e967df00e523'}

```{.r .cell-code}
m1 <-
  linear_reg() # engine ist "lm" im Default
```
:::




Modell fitten:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-01_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_4d8173901a37f533359a910073bf4d87'}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit1 <-
  m1 %>% 
  fit(Sale_Price ~ Gr_Liv_Area, data = ames)
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-01_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_53674188f5b35a9ca20b886545b7cef7'}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit1 %>% pluck("fit") 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
stats::lm(formula = Sale_Price ~ Gr_Liv_Area, data = data)

Coefficients:
(Intercept)  Gr_Liv_Area  
  4.8552133    0.0002437  
```


:::
:::




Modellgüte im Train-Sample:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-01_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_93b09e8ca77770e8a92433c7ab663508'}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit1_performance <-
  fit1 %>% 
  extract_fit_engine()  # identisch zu pluck("fit")
```
:::



Modellgüte:



::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-01_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_a7a72b11b110521b71bd889f3759218e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit1_performance %>% summary()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
stats::lm(formula = Sale_Price ~ Gr_Liv_Area, data = data)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-1.02587 -0.06577  0.01342  0.07202  0.39231 

Coefficients:
             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept) 4.855e+00  7.355e-03  660.12   <2e-16 ***
Gr_Liv_Area 2.437e-04  4.648e-06   52.43   <2e-16 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.1271 on 2928 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.4842,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.484 
F-statistic:  2749 on 1 and 2928 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16
```


:::
:::



R-Quadrat via easystats:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-01_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_e98847d8fe36c69bd7d3cc8531047219'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(easystats)
fit1_performance %>% r2()  # rmse()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# R2 for Linear Regression
       R2: 0.484
  adj. R2: 0.484
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-01_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_f926a4186883e0a0b2b194e28bf5037f'}

```{.r .cell-code}
tidy(fit1_performance)  # ähnlich zu parameters()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 5
  term        estimate  std.error statistic p.value
  <chr>          <dbl>      <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>
1 (Intercept) 4.86     0.00736        660.        0
2 Gr_Liv_Area 0.000244 0.00000465      52.4       0
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-01_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_385444dd236384b7f28c74a2881e1f28'}

```{.r .cell-code}
sol <- 0.484
```
:::
